posts.post_content:
Hall of Famer Frank Baker, ungraded, Polar Bear back.

My scan turned out a bit funky, but it does allow you to see the obvious flaws: creases. Also, when I hold the card in my hand, the colors don't seem as vibrant as the example of this card I have in my collection.

Wait, this is the B/S/T. What am I doing focusing on the flaws? Shouldn't I be waxing eloquently about the fantastic corners? (Also, I'm able to post my own scans. What's up with that?)

Bottom line: Decent-looking card, not a beater, not a Sweet Cap or Piedmont back and a HOFer.

Price is $xxx delivered within the United States.

PayPal is fine. No need to "gift" your payment.

A commitment to buy takes precedence over an ongoing negotiation. :rolleyes:

[URL="wolfie51sb@aol.com"]Feel free to email any questions.[/URL]

Thanks,

Rob

[URL="wolfie51sb@aol.com"]wolfie51sb at aol dot com [/URL]

[IMG]http://photos.imageevent.com/ineedanap/otherphotos/frank-baker.jpg[/IMG]
Do you use a 3D scanner? Those creases pop!

[quote name="Jacklitsch" post=1207255]Do you use a 3D scanner? Those creases pop![/QUOTE]

Still learning about selling. Might have misunderstood the whole "enhanced scan" thing.
Reduced to $50. If it doesn't sell at this price, I'll just mail it to Frank Baker's grand niece and have her autograph it.
